intro: Crotalaria mohlenbrockii, commonly known as Mohlenbrock's crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as prairies and along stream banks.
